etymologies: modern Latin, from Greek geranion, from geranos ‘crane’

definitions: a herbaceous plant or small shrub of a genus that comprises the cranesbills and their relatives. Geraniums bear a long, narrow fruit that is said to be shaped like the bill of a crane.
shortDefinitions: herbaceous plant or small shrub of genus that comprises cranesbills and their relatives

definitions: (in general or informal use) a cultivated pelargonium.
shortDefinitions: (in general or informal use) cultivated pelargonium

definitions: the scarlet color of many cultivated pelargoniums.
shortDefinitions: scarlet colour of many cultivated pelargoniums
